column4: I have an 18 MB Partition -- its Hidden / W95 FAT32 0x1b -- @ /dev/sda4 -- Should I DELETE it?
No, grub only uses a dedicated partition if you're using gpt. What does the partition contain?
I think windows in some cases creates a boot partition. I'd at least look at the contents before deleting it
how would I go about looking at the contents?
mount: you must specify the filesystem type

The syntax is "sudo mount -t vfat /dev/sda4 /mnt" but if it were really a fat filesystem the kernel would have autodetect it. Since there doesn't seem to be a valid filesystem on that partition it's probably safe to remove it
http://codepad.org/6siAaTIz the code you gave me doesnt work? Palimpset states it is Hidden W95 FAT32 (0x1b)
Yes, because there is no valid filesystem on that partition
then how do I view the contents as you suggested?
You can't, it looks like there are no valid contents
Which is why I think it's safe to delete
the partition is empty? no data inside?
Change the default to "Windows 7 (loader) (on /dev/sda1)" (with quotes) and it doesn't matter what order / number it is
My grub file for your review before I restart my netbook. Also deleted that 18 MB partition. http://codepad.org/UtX8GjvW
